title: I cannot connect to most webpages
content: I just cannot connect to most webpages, the links do not work but they do in other browsers.
creator: ludovico_alcorta

title: Picture in Picture
content: Hello Mozilla, I like your picture-in-picture feature in Firefox. Is it possible to check via JavaScript if a user has PIP enabled? Some events like "enterpictureinpicture" are described on your website https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Picture-in-Picture_API, but have not yet been implemented. When will this happen? It is important for web designers to know whether a visitor uses this feature - for example to hide the original video. Or is there another method to hide it?
creator: ChristophSchmid

title: nová verze
content: Dobrý den, když nainstaluji Firefox od verze 102 výšší verzi, zvětší se mi písmena a celý prostor na monitoru. Co s tím? Když nainstaluji zpět 102 je vše v pořádku. Musím blokovat aktualizace. Jirka

title: Spell check not working
content: Spell check doesn't work at all. It doesn't show incorrectly spelled words, and there's nothing in the write click menu in text areas. I have it turned on in settings, and I have a dictionary installed.
creator: dzvanhoffen

title: Firefox freezes
content:
Sometimes, when I have 4-5 tabs open, I scroll on a page and suddenly everything freezes. The opened pages are news portals I can't switch between pages, I can't close pages Switching to another application in Linux everything works fine. I can close Firefox and restore the previous pages after reopening. No error message. The about:crashes is empty. In gnome-system-monitor firefox-bin looks good

Linux Mint 20.3 Cinnamon Everything is the latest version It is not caused by a Firefox add-on

Sorry for my bad English
creator: anaconda1

title: Bookmarks
content: With the last 2 updates, my bookmarks have not been reinstated on the bookmarks toolbar. They are listed under "Bookmarks"; how do I get them on to the Toolbar again? I am using version 104.0.2 (64 bit)

title: Autofill passwords
content:
My ability to access saved passwords on regular sites I visit is lost each time I turn my laptop off. This means each time I log onto Mozilla I have to reset Privacy. This does not happen on Microsoft Edge. As I would really like to use Mozilla I would like to sort it out.

regards, Andrew
creator: aygeebee70

title: Ticket was closed - censorship?
content:
Feels like heavy censorship this was closed right away shortly after creating the thread... https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1390467

Why was this closed? Why would Dropa recommend private browsing mode / incognito mode? This mode has nothing to do with being private, google safe browsing, do i have to say more? Google and privacy don't fit !!! Besides, there are SO MANY youtube videos where people explain why incognito mode IS NOT private, so to be honest that is a really lame response to what i have said in the original post.
creator: Firefox_Beginner
